issue.title: atlas_sim_interface_state needs timestamp (to debug bursty comms)

content.html:
Can you comment on difference between tcpNoDelay(true) and "unreliable()"? I've used unreliable() in other places (but not for this message, fixing now) I note the link you gave has "unreliable().reliable()"

    // ros::TransportHints().reliable().tcpNoDelay(true);
    ros::TransportHints().unreliable().reliable().tcpNoDelay(true);

If we only care about processing the latest message, is one better than the other?

Do we need queue > 1 if only processing latest?
